topic.title: Customizing Web Author for Your Content

ul.li: Your content is identified by a document type
Support for a document type is called a framework.
Support for frameworks is pluggable. We have several ones builtin, some open source (JATS) or you can develop one yourself.
If you are using a DITA specialization or a flavor of XHTML, you should extend the default framework
If you are using a completely different format, you need to develop the framework yourself using the source code of the builtin frameworks

body.p:
What you can configure
Document schema: e.g. spec de DITA
Authoring experience: e.g. form controls, actions
Inline editing
Business rules
file templates
embedded formats
Custom framework from scratch - the most complicated things are: custom actions and table support.
Tutorial: How to extend a framework, test it with the Test Server and deploy it to Web Author. How to preserve it during upgrades.

section.title: Business rules
section.p: Content quality can be controlled with business rules that are related to either the document structure or the content itself. The former can be enforced using Schematron rules while the second can be enforced using a plugin provided by Acrolinx.

section.title: Embedded formats
section.p: Web Author supports embedded formats such as MathML, SVG, videos, and more using a flexible form-controls mechanism.
Support for other embedded formats can be implemented by third parties. For example, WIRIS provides a plugin that can be used to edit MathML equations in a visual way.
